name: crashingly

crashingly adverb
(EXTREMELY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly disapproving extremely or completely: I don't need to tell you how crashingly boring these people are. She had no answers to these crashingly obvious questions.
More examplesFewer examplesThis job would be crashingly dull if I was doing it for someone else.The castle was built by one of those crashingly tasteless aristocrats.You have to admit that he got it crashingly wrong.

crashingly adverb
(LOUDLY)
making loud noises like those made when things break or fall: Suddenly they heard a crashingly loud noise. Finally, she jumped from the stones and scampered crashingly away through the bushes.
More examplesFewer examplesIt is a spectacular show, with hundreds of dancers and a crashingly amplified soundtrack.We met for lunch at one of those crashingly noisy restaurants that he likes.She attempts to make the film fun, with fast editing and crashingly loud sound effects.
